intro: Pimpinella komarovii, commonly known as Komarov's茴香, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its native range.
